The Faustians have made their deal not with the Devil, but with the ever-seductive Enchantress and that may be just as deadly. Have your psychic ribbons and lethal weapons at the ready. for the hunt is on! But beware a land where the dead walk, the faerie folk flutter, and ragtag band of ne'er do wells perform for your entertainment. That's right, it's the Guardians of the Galaxy, 17th century style!

82.heading: Serbian Nationalists.
82.title: Fatherland : a Family History
82.author: Nina Bunjevac.
notes: "Standing alongside Marjane Satrapi's Persepolis and Joe Sacco's Palestine, Nina Bunjevac's Fatherland renders the searing history of the Balkans in the twentieth century through the experiences of the author and her family. In 1975, fearing her husband's growing fanaticism, Nina Bunjevac's mother fled her marriage and adopted country of Canada, taking Nina

and her older sister back to Yugoslavia to live with her parents. Her husband and Nina's father, Peter, was a die-hard Serbian nationalist who was forced to leave his country in the 1950s. Remaining in Canada, he became involved with a terrorist organization bent on overthrowing the Communist Yugoslav government and attacking its supporters in North America. Then in 1977, while his family was still in Yugoslavia, Peter was killed in an accidental explosion while building a bomb. Through exquisite and haunting black-and-white art, Nina Bunjevac documents the immediate circumstances surrounding her father's death and provides a sweeping account of the former Yugoslavia under fascism and communism, telling an unforgettable true story of how the scars of history are borne by family and nation alike."

Summary (from OCLC): Serenity Harper is the new girl in school and she seems determined to make everyone hate her. Derek, Kimberley, and the rest of the Prayer Club make it their project to be nice to her no matter how she treats them in order to bring her around to a Christian way of life.

141.title: Serenity ; 2 Stepping Out
141.author: art by Min Kwon ; created by Buzz Dixon ; original character designs by Drigz Abrot.

publication info.publisher: Barbour Pub. in association with Realbuzz Studios

notes: "Serenity is warming up to the Christian kids who made her their "project" by showing her an unconditional love she's never experienced before. But when she tries ducking responsibility for wrecking Kimberly's car, that unconditional love turns tough. Can Serenity understand it's for her own good?"

142.title: Serenity ; 3 Basket Case
142.author: created by Buzz Dixon ; art by Min Kwon ; original character designs by Drigz Abrot.
notes: "The Prayer Club's pet project is at her flaky best, dissing a health class assignment that has teens caring for chicken eggs 24/7 to simulate the round-the-clock nurturing a baby requires. But when an overwhelming responsibility falls in Serenity's lap, where can she get help
from the friends she's mocked, or the God she doen't quite believe in?"
Religious genre, about teenagers and Christian life.

143.title: Serenity ; 4 Rave-n-Rant
143.author: art by Min Kwon ; created by Buzz Dixon ; original character designs by Drigz Abrot.

publication info.publisher: Barbour Pub. in association with Realbuzz Studios

notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): Serenity begins to share her soul with her Prayer Club friends and is angered to find that, while they say they love Serenity, they don't always like her. The teen with the blue hair and attitude takes her frustrations to God, but soon decides He isn't listening, until a surprise ending makes Serenity realize there may be something after all.

144.title: Serenity ; 5 Snow Biz

publication info.publisher: Barbour Pub. in association with Realbuzz Studios

notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): When Serenity attends a new school, the Christian Prayer Club decides to take her under their wing and show her friendship and love in the hopes of replacing her anger and sarcasm and bring her to God.

145.title: Serenity ; 6 You Shall Love
145.author: art by Min Kwon ; created by Buzz Dixon.
notes: "Her leg's in a cast, the power's out, and Serenity is bored stiff. Reluctantly, she picks up the Bible she received when she first visited the Prayer Club, and soon loses herself in the Word of God. Before long, she's pestering her friends with spiritual questions. Is this the dawning of faith for the troubled girl who's made life so interesting for the Christian kids of James A. Madison High?"
